question.title: sourceCompatibility and targetCompatibility of Java 11 in Flutter apps for support upto Android 7 (API 24)
question.body:
This is what my android/app/build.gradle.kts file looks like (only a portion shown):

android {
    ... ...
    ... ...
    compileOptions {
        sourceCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_11
        targetCompatibility = JavaVersion.VERSION_11
    }
    ... ...
    ... ...
}

The project uses default values for other important config options, which are determined by file <flutter_install_dir>/packages/flutter_tools/gradle/src/main/kotlin/FlutterExtension.kt:

open class FlutterExtension {
    val compileSdkVersion: Int = 36
    val minSdkVersion: Int = 24
    val targetSdkVersion: Int = 36
    val ndkVersion: String = "27.0.12077973"
    ... ...
    ... ...
    ... ...
}

The AGP version is: "8.9.1"

Use this table to determine which Java version is supported by each Android API, and where to find details on which Java APIs are available.

(Source: Java versions in Android builds)

Android        Java
14 (API 34)    17
13 (API 33)    11
12 (API 32)    11

UPDATE:

My Question Previously (now changed to that follows this): I am trying to understand what sourceCompatibility and targetCompatibility options are in order to be able to configure them properly for my projects. As you can see my project targets API 36 but the Java version used is VERSION_11. So, I suppose this table given in official documentation shows maximum supported Java version! Please correct me if I am wrong. I read somewhere that source and target compatibility of Java also determines the Android Runtime (ART). How to select these versions for (1) scalability, (2) latest features?

My Updated Question:

According to the documentation (Which Java APIs can I use in my Java or Kotlin source code? and Which Android versions run which Java versions?), the supported Java APIs for Android versions are:

 Android           Java
 14 (API 34)       17
 13 (API 33)       11
 11,12 (API 31,32) 11
  7 (API 24,25)     8
2-6 (AIP 9-23)      6

Since, my minSdkVersion is 24 I would tend to think that Java version 8 is the appropriate for my project to support the lowest possible Android version. However, when I changed the sourceCompatibility and targetCompatibility to VERSION_1_8 (Java version 8), I started getting the following warnings:

warning: [options] source value 8 is obsolete and will be removed in a future release
warning: [options] target value 8 is obsolete and will be removed in a future release

Currently, API 24 seems to be the recommended minSdk (as this is default with Flutter 3.35.x) and so I don't want to set my minSdk to 32 and use Java 11.

How do I support down till Android 7 (API 24) with Java 11?

Notes:

  • Google seems to have removed support for API 24 emulators. Though I could still install the emulator, I could not install package that was build with minSdk=24 support. Surprising! Similarly, emulators upto API 30 (Android 11) were unsupported as I tested them on Sep. 02, 2025.
  • Finally, I tested with API 31 (Android 12), and this was supported and could also run the app which was compiled minSdk of 24!

Stats on Android device usage suggest if Android 12, is what we base out minSdk version we would be loosing a lot of devices:

question_comments.body: From my update to the question, it seems I am required to go with Java version 11 and minSdk of 31 instead of 24 or 23!
